Class ShopSystem

java.lang.Object
ShopSystem
public class ShopSystem
extends java.lang.Object
This class is the main shop system worked behind views

  • Constructor Details

    • ShopSystem

      public ShopSystem​(Model m)
      Creates a new instance of ShopSystem. Make sure to call the "init" method after this!
      Parameters:
      m - The Model with all of the back-end links that the store is to use

  • Method Details

    • setView

      public void setView​(View view)
      Sets the shop's current view after setting the view's system and initializing it.
      Parameters:
      view - The view to set

    • getWindow

      public javax.swing.JFrame getWindow()
      Returns:
      The JFrame that holds the shop.

    • getBackend

      public Model getBackend()
      Returns:
      The Model instance controlling the shop.

    • init

      public void init()
      Initialize and show the shop window. Displays the LoginView.

    • showPopup

      public void showPopup​(java.lang.String message)
      Shows a popup message.
      Parameters:
      message - The text in the popup window.

    • getCurrentCustomerDetails

      public Customer getCurrentCustomerDetails()
      Returns:
      The customer details received from the Model instance.

    • signup

      public void signup​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String pass, java.lang.String confPass, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String phone, java.lang.String card)
      Attempts to sign up a user. This will display an error to the user if any of the following are true: - The user ID is less than 3 chars long - The password is less than 5 chars long - The two passwords do not match. If all of the above tests succeed then the back-end will be asked to create a user. If the back-end succeeds in creating an account, the user will be logged in, if not, they will be shown an error.
      Parameters:
      username - The entered user ID.
      pass - The entered password.
      confPass - The entered confirmed password.
      address - The entered address
      phone - The entered phone
      card - The entered card

    • login

      public void login​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      If the login succeeds, they will be presented with the product list, if not, they will be shown an error.
      Parameters:
      username - The supplied username
      password - The supplied password

    • updateUserDetails

      public void updateUserDetails​(Customer c)
      Calls the appropriate methods on the Model instance to update the information about the current user. If no user is logged in, an error message will be displayed in the console.
      Parameters:
      c - The new user details.

    • showCheckout

      public void showCheckout()
      Shows the checkout dialog.

      public Cart getCart()
      Returns:
      The current user's cart.
